to make room for co-founder Larry Page. Eric Schmidt will move into an Executive Chairman role. But why? And what does it mean for you? According to Eric Schmidt : Larry will now lead product development and technology strategy, his greatest strengths, and starting from April 4 he will take charge of our day-to-day operations as Google's Chief Executive Officer. In this new role I know he will merge Google's technology and business vision brilliantly. The third leg of the triumvirate, Sergey Brin , will take the title of Co-Founder, focusing on new products. Jefferies feels that the move by Google to switch Eric Schmidt to Executive Chairman for CEO could not have come at a better time with such a strong last quarter. They are a little skeptic and state that, it does introduce a level of uncertainty around execution under the new leadership, particularly considering the growing competitive landscape.
